intro: Asparagus fallax, commonly known as the silver asparagus, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its finely divided, silver-gray leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Asparagus fallax is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and ease of cultivation.
